ReportSection.name: Overview
ReportSection.title: Project Plan Update 2020-21
ReportSection.Static:
In May 2020 the AGE-WELL Network Management Office surveyed Project Leads to better understand the current and anticipated impact of COVID-19 on funded projects. Teams were told at that time that they will have an opportunity to submit a revised project plan and budget at a later date.

In light of research disruptions and delays due to COVID-19, AGE-WELL will not undertake an Annual Project Progress Evaluation (APPE) of its multi-year projects this fall as planned. Instead, projects funded through the AGE-WELL Core Research Program and Platform Project Program will complete the project update process outlined in this document consisting of updates to project status, project plans and project outputs by January 15, 2021 via the Forum research portal.

The Forum portal is the primary mechanism for preparing and submitting progress reports and funding requests, and serves as a central repository for information about people, projects, and activities within AGE-WELL. The project update process requires Project Leads to ensure that their Forum project profiles are up to date and that all project HQP have been added to the portal. How-to guides for Forum reporting and adding HQP are included in this document. A separate Budget Update process will proceed as usual in February 2021. Project Leads will prepare and submit a revised project budget at that time including an estimate of unspent funds at year-end.

The intent of the revised 2020-21 process is to ensure that RMC is able to assess how newly funded AGE-WELL projects and programs are faring in light of COVID-19 and to understand how projects have changed or will change their approaches in this new environment. Project teams will have the opportunity to meet with network Scientific Directors and Network Management Office team members following the project update process to ensure the appropriate network supports are available to their teams.

Projects will not be evaluated against specific performance metrics as part of the update process; therefore the second instalments of funding that are usually tied to mid-term reviews will be released in November as planned prior to receipt of updated project plans. Any adjustments required to term lengths, budgets, and project plans will be in place for April 1, 2021.

Important Dates:

January 15, 2021 Completion of Project Status, Plan Update and Project Output Reporting in Forum
February 19, 2021 Completion of Budget Update module in Forum
Instructions will circulate in January. This is the standard Forum budget module for AGE-WELL funded projects.
April 1, 2021 Release of 2021-22 Funding Letters

ReportSection.name: Project Reporting
ReportSection.title: C. Project Reporting 2020-21
ReportSection.Static:
AGE-WELL’s performance management framework typically combines a balanced scorecard approach with output reporting via the Forum research portal. For fiscal year 2020-21, the network will defer use of the balanced scorecard as part of a mid-year evaluation process but will retain project output reporting via Forum as part of its annual reporting process. Project Leads as are asked to report project outputs, achievements and partner contributions via Forum by January 15, 2021.

As mentioned above, projects will not be evaluated against specific performance metrics; project output reporting through Forum is also used by the Network Management Office to support network annual reporting and to understand network performance. Project teams will be asked to update Forum again at the end of fiscal year.

Forum reporting updates can be made to Forum at any time and it is expected that Project Leads keep project information up to date in Forum throughout the life of the project. Information about AGE-WELL reporting is maintained on the network intranet: A “How-To” reporting guide has been prepared and can be found here: Annual Reporting on Forum – How-To Guide. (See also Appendix A)

Key links are included below:
  • All project outputs and outcomes that have been produced in this last fiscal year (publications, presentations, patents etc.), partially funded by AGE-WELL and/or related to their AGE-WELL research agenda, must be entered in the Forum: https://forum.agewellnce.ca/index.php/Special:ManageProducts
  • All financial contributions (cash and in-kind)  from partners and other sources enhancing AGE-WELL funded activities must be entered in the system: https://forum.agewell-nce.ca/index.php/Special:Contributions
  • Forum profiles must be complete for all Network Investigators and HQP, including university affiliations, bio tab in full, associated projects, supervisory relations. It is the supervisor’s responsibility to ensure project HQP are set up in Forum. Project Leads may designate a team member to create Forum accounts for HQP using the Project Support role in Forum. (See also Appendix B)
  • EPIC tabs must be up-to-date for HQP
